subject: Re: [junit] running a single test method out of 20 methods in my 	junittest in eclipse how to ?
msgSnippet: This has nothing to do with speed, it s just convenient to be able to run just the one test method you are currently developing or debugging. For example, the
messageBody:
This has nothing to do with speed, it's just convenient to be able to run
just the one test method you are currently developing or debugging.

For example, the twenty tests could be exercising the same area of your code
but only that one test fails, so you really don't want to waste time having
your breakpoint go off 19 times for tests that you know are passing.

--
Cedric


On Mon, Sep 1, 2008 at 2:55 PM, Steve Freeman <smgfreeman@...> wrote:

> Just incidentally, why? Your unit tests should be so fast that you
> don't care. Or are you using junit to write larger-scale tests?
>
> S.
>
>

> > single test method is there a way .I run junit tests from eclipse ,
> > so is
> > there any way in eclipse i can ask junit runner to run just one
> > test method
> > or few test methods and not all ?
>
